PSA: This Course will no longer be available June 30th 2016 onwards
                            Coursera announced that they will be shutting off their old platform on June 30th. Over  400 courses that are part
                                of the old stack will be no longer be available. You can find the  complete list here.
                            
                            

                            
                                Read this guide to learn how to download this course before the old platform shuts down. 

                                The guide provides two ways to download the courses - Chrome Plugin and Python Script. Depending on which method you use, check the appropriate sections below for further details.
                            
                            
                            
                                To download this course you need to be enrolled in the course.
                                                                Unfortunately this course is closed for enrollment to new students. If you hadn't signed up before, you will not be able to download the course.
                                

                                                            

                            Chrome Plugin

                                                                If you had signed up for this course you will be able to download and save the course materials using the chrome plugin. Click on Go To Class and Log in to your Coursera account to do so.
                            
                            Python Script
                            
                                                                For the python script to work you will need a class name. Pick one from below:
                                                                    stschina1-001
                                                                    stschina1-002
                                
                                
                                If more than one class name below, pick the last one. If the script fails, pick the one above that and try again. Not all of these class names are guranteed to work.


                            






                        
                    
                    Science and technology continue to play an increasingly central role in
our lives, not least in countries such as China that are undergoing rapid
technological, economic and social change. This course is the first
of a trilogy of short courses on science, technology, and society in China.
Here, we explore in general terms how engineering as well as scientific
knowledge and practice are influenced by dynamic interactions between science,
technology, innovation, and society. The course will introduce the
innovation systems approach, laying the groundwork for mastering the remaining
two parts of the course by introducing broad concepts and ideas to provide
students with a platform on which to think about the science/technology–society
relationship and related policy issues with a focus on China. This
understanding will then be applied more specifically to China in the next
two courses in the series. Part II will examine the impact of the Industrial
Revolution in the West on scientific and technological progress in China.
Part III will examine science and technology in Chinese society today and
the basis for the policy prescriptions the Chinese government is currently
employing to promote innovation and technology development.




                                            Syllabus
                        Week 1: Definitional IssuesWeek 2: Impact of Modern Science and Technology (S&T) in ChinaWeek 3: Systems of Innovation and Innovation Policy
title: Science, Technology, and Society in China I: Basic Concepts
